author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Within the market's chamber, dread takes flight,
As hawks of steel descend in Israel's night.
The sparrows of the air, they bow and cower,
At news of Hamas' unleashed power.

Again, to Rio Tinto shall the goats traipse,
Unyielding in their iron-clad capes.
From Pilbara's heart, the shipment's yield,
Sets a steadfast pace across the field.

Though silent is the snail in shade of weeks,
In whispering shells, Iran's plot speaks.
To Israel, a deadly sting they cast,
In twisted mischief of the shrouded past.

feedItems.title: European Airline Stocks Fall After Attack on Israel
feedItems.description: European defence stocks rose sharply, while airline stocks fell on the news that Hamas launched an attack on Israel over the weekend.

feedItems.title: Rio Tinto Backs Pilbara Outlook
feedItems.description: Rio Tinto kept its guidance to cost and shipments for Pilbara unchanged for 2023 and targeted shipments of 323-338 million tons for next year.

feedItems.title: Iran Helped Plot Attack on Israel Over Several Weeks

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In September's late measure, bond markets turned cold,
Eurozone's struggle leaves tales to be told.
A plunge in the prices, a bitter swoon,
Year-to-date performance hums a doleful tune.

Metro Bank's lifeline, a hefty sum gained,
From investors' pouch to balance retained.
Jaime Gilinski Bacal now holds the dome,
Whilst bondholders and shareholders feel the comb.

Brent Oil ascends in a rapturous dance,
Above a hundred, given the chance.
Amidst Eastern turmoil, price takes flight,
Iran's supply under a precarious knight.

feedItems.title: Eurozone Bond Markets Got 'Ice-Cold Shower' in September
feedItems.description: The performance of eurozone government bonds was spoiled in September, as the third quarter ended with a plunge in bond prices, bringing the year-to-date performance to negative, LBBW said.

feedItems.title: Metro Bank Agrees Funding Package with Investors
feedItems.description: Metro Bank said it secured £925 million in funding to shore up its balance-sheet issues, in a move that will hit current investors and bondholders and make Colombian billionaire Jaime Gilinski Bacal the bank’s controlling shareholder.

feedItems.title: Brent Oil Futures Could Surge Above $100/Bbl in Short Term
feedItems.description: Oil prices rose sharply in Europe, with uncertainty over the situation in the Middle East mounting after the Hamas attack on Israel, and if Iran is linked to the attack, then its oil supply and exports face imminent downside risks, Commonwealth Bank of Australia said.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
"Lo! The dollar, strong and fair,
The crown of currency, none dare,
"Morgan Stanley," 'gainst it doubts cast,
Yet its strength in charm doth last.

A tale told of Schaeffler's bold quest,
A bid for Vitesco, deemed best.
€91 a piece, the price might appease,
In cash, a deal to set hearts at ease.

Oh, Evergrande, thine woes are vast,
NWTN's faith, doth it last?
Thy shadow o'er green dreams cast,
In doubt, thou've been typecast.

feedItems.title: US Dollar's Dominant Role Seen Unlikely to Be at Large Risk
feedItems.description: Morgan Stanley maintains a long position view on the dollar for now, as it said it “generally take[s] a more skeptical view of USD losing its ‘dominant currency’ crown, though some of the critiques are not unfounded.”

feedItems.title: Schaeffler Makes €3.6 Billion Bid for Vitesco
feedItems.description: Schaeffler has offered €91 a share in cash for Vitesco Technologies, the first of three steps toward a combination of the two companies.

feedItems.title: China Evergrande New Energy Vehicle Investor Casts Doubt on Investment
feedItems.description: Ongoing troubles at beleaguered property developer China Evergrande have cast a shadow over Nasdaq-listed NWTN’s investment in its electric-vehicle unit.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In Germany fair, the forge doth stall,
As kin of Vulcan echo fall.
Like 'gainst the anvil, hammer struck,
Their mighty industry runs amuck. 

Investors ponder on coin and stocks,
Watery fears in money box.
Neath Fed's cold gaze, their hopes do wane,
Like sailors 'fore a stormy main. 

IT lore-men, skilled in coded word,
Find the market's gifts absurd.
In market's tumult, they find no cheer,
Like ship without a steersman's steer.

feedItems.title: German Industrial Production Falls More Than Expected
feedItems.description: Germany’s industrial output declined 0.2% in August, yet more negative news for the country’s key manufacturing base.

feedItems.title: Investors worried about the recent pullback in stocks are counting on the coming earnings season to give them something to get excited about amid anxieties over the Fed's attitude to interest rates.
feedItems.description: Investors worried about the recent pullback in stocks are counting on the coming earnings season to give them something to get excited about amid anxieties over the Fed’s attitude to interest rates.

feedItems.title: Amid a strong labor market overall, employment opportunities for information technology professionals appear poor, according to an analysis by Janco Associates, which tracks federal data.
feedItems.description: Amid a strong labor market overall, employment opportunities for information technology professionals appear poor, according to an analysis by Janco Associates, which tracks federal data.
